content.description: Sit start with both hands on nice jagged edge and make first move to side-pull/pinch on the right. Power up to the next right hand, and the rest is V0/V1 moves. Down climb or fight the poison oak to get off. Dangerous landing with uneven rocks below (route moves right of the start).
content.location: To the right of "The Duece" on the upstream side of the boulder.

content.description: Standing start with both hands on a really obvious nice hold. Route goes left to a heel-hook on the ledge, traverses right across the slab, then goes up to the top-out. Careful of poison oak! Walk off the back of the boulder (downstream creek side) and fight the poison oak, or down-climb and jump to crash pad. Name comes from the deuce that someone dropped behind this boulder near the route (careful not to land in it). Route has been brushed and moss is gone from all holds and edges as of 5/13/19
content.location: Downstream of main Stevens Canyon Boulder. Boulder is across the road and creek from the Stevens Creek County Park Canyon Trail entrance. Walk down and hop the creek. Walk around to the face of the boulder from the downstream side.

content.description: Traverse from left to right on the Lower Stevens Canyon Boulder starting on a very obvious jug when you approach the boulder. End on the starting hold of "The Deuce." Nice jug holds turning into more slopy holds as the traverse goes on. Moves get progressively harder. Make sure to stay low and not high on the ledge, or it takes away from the climb.
content.location: Starting on the left side of the Lower Stevens Canyon Boulder
